author: Alex Wu
description: China is strengthening its precious metal resource development in Latin America as a strategic asset to hedge against the U.S. dollar, says an analyst.
title: Canada’s Barrick, China’s Shandong Gold Seek to Add $400 Million Investment in Argentine Mine

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse at the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Trump Meets Putin, World War II Anniversary, and Wildfire in Spain

author: Emel Akan, Ryan Morgan
description: Trump said 'there's no deal until there's a deal' and said he would consult with NATO and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
title: Trump–Putin Summit Ends With Hopes of Deal but No Cease-Fire

author: Chandra Philip
description: Kellogg’s decision to remove artificial dyes from its products including popular cereals also applies to items sold in Canada, the company has confirmed. The company made the announcement in response to moves by the U.S. administration to remove synthetic food dyes from products. Kellogg’s confirmed to The Epoch Times that the artificial dye removal would […]
title: Kellogg’s Says Artificial Dye Removal From Cereals Also Covers Canadian Products

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Conservative Party is calling for the parliamentary public safety committee to investigate the federal government’s expenditure of at least $170,000 on repatriating from Syria Canadian women who had joined the ISIS terrorist group. The letter signed by Conservative MPs asks the Standing Committee on Public Safety and National Security to convene immediately and investigate […]
title: Conservatives Urge Parliamentary Probe Into Government Spending on Repatriating Canadian ISIS Women

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada’s business community is sounding the alarm as Air Canada prepares to ground nearly all flights by Aug. 16 if no deal is reached with unionized flight attendants. The labour dispute has been ongoing since the start of this year over pay and work conditions, with around 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants who belong to […]
title: Business Groups Sound Alarm Over Potential Air Canada Shutdown, Citing ‘Significant Economic Damage’

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: With less than 24 hours remaining before Canada’s largest airline fully grounds nearly all flights, unionized Air Canada flight attendants have rejected Ottawa’s attempts to consider binding arbitration to force a deal. Intervention by Ottawa to bring the eight-month dispute to a close through binding arbitration should be “firmly rejected,” according to an Aug. 15 […]
title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Reject Airline’s Request to Start Binding Arbitration Talks

author: Andrea Hannen
description: Commentary A report on the progress of the federal government’s child-care program has recently been published by the Childcare Resource and Research Unit (CRRU). The CRRU’s mandate includes “work to bring about a universal, publicly funded, high quality, inclusive and public/not-for-profit early learning and child care system in Canada.” The federal child-care program was marketed […]
title: New Report Exposes Flaws in Federal Child-Care Scheme

author: Austin Alonzo
description: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink and Roche vice-chairman André Hoffmann will lead the World Economic Forum as interim co-chairs.
title: WEF Investigation Finds ‘Minor Irregularities,’ No Material Wrongdoing by Schwab

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Canadian Constitution Foundation (CCF) has announced it is requesting a judicial review of the Nova Scotia government’s ban on entering wooded areas of the province, which was implemented to mitigate forest fires. “Sweeping restrictions like these undermine trust in public safety measures and raise serious questions about government overreach,” CCF litigation director Christine Van […]
title: Legal Group Seeks Judicial Review of Nova Scotia’s Forest Ban

author: Chandra Philip
description: A B.C. nurse has had her licence suspended for a month and has been ordered to pay more than $90,000 after she was found liable of “professional misconduct” by the B.C. College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM) due to comments she made about gender issues. The BCCNM announced its disciplinary decision on Aug. 14, after […]
title: BC Nurse Ordered to Pay More Than $90K Following Misconduct Allegations on Gender Remarks

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Conservative MP Blaine Calkins is planning to reintroduce a private members’ bill to repeal portions of a 2023 law that increased regulations on natural health products, saying he expects it to pass with NDP and Green party support. Natural health products (NHPs) in Canada have been increasingly regulated since the passage of Bill C-47. The […]
title: Conservative MP Plans to Reintroduce Bill Easing Regulations on Natural Health Products

author: Carolina Avendano
description: In-depth A shooting threat sent to Vancouver’s Queen Elizabeth Theatre earlier this year bore the name of an outspoken critic of the Chinese regime. Posing as Sheng Xue, a Chinese Canadian pro-democracy activist, the sender threatened to “enter as a spectators” and open fire if a performance by the U.S. dance company Shen Yun went […]
title: How Beijing Targets Critics, Dissidents in Canada

author: Adam Morrow
description: Ukraine’s military has played down the scale of the advance while sending additional troops to the Donetsk frontline, saying the situation has stabilized.
title: Russian Military Thrust Tests Key Ukrainian Frontline

author: The Canadian Press
description: Descendants of war veterans gathered today at the National War Memorial in Ottawa to mark the official end of the Second World War. This year marks the 80th anniversary of Japan’s surrender and the end of a global conflict that claimed the lives of more than 45,000 Canadian soldiers. Sweat poured down the faces of […]
title: Canadians Mark 80th Anniversary of End to WWII in Ottawa

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A majority of Canadians say the federal government’s Electric Vehicle (EV) mandate that prohibits the sale of new gas-powered vehicles by 2035 is “unrealistic” and should be scrapped, according to a new survey. The national poll conducted by Leger heard from 1,617 respondents, and found that 71 percent agreed with a statement that said, “This […]
title: 71 Percent of Canadians Say EV Mandates ‘Unrealistic,’ Want it Scrapped: Survey

author: Victoria Friedman
description: South Korea's president said the move aimed to ease border tensions and encourage Pyongyang to respond to Seoul’s efforts to reopen inter-Korean dialogue.
title: South Korea to End Some Military Activities on Border With North Korea

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: More recalls have been issued for a popular type of chocolate following a salmonella outbreak connected to specific brands of pistachios and products containing pistachios. A number of additional brands of Dubai pistachio and knafeh milk chocolate have been pulled off the shelves 10 days after the original recall, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) […]
title: Dubai Chocolate Recall Widens Amid Salmonella Outbreak Linked to Pistachios

author: The Canadian Press
description: Statistics Canada says manufacturing sales edged up June and a smaller share of firms reported an impact from U.S. tariffs. The agency said Friday that manufacturing sales in June rose 0.3 percent to $68.5 billion, breaking a streak of four consecutive monthly declines. Petroleum and coal sales increased 11.8 percent to $6.8 billion in June, […]
title: Fewer Firms Report US Tariff Hit as Manufacturing Sales Edge up in June

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Alberta Beef Producers says it will pull out of the Canadian Cattle Association next year, citing a lack of membership benefits for beef farmers in the province. The withdrawal will be effective as of July 1, 2026.  Alberta Beef Producers (ABP) chair Doug Roxburgh said the board of directors voted to withdraw from the […]
title: Alberta Beef Producers Set to Exit Canadian Cattle Association in 2026

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) says it has reached a resolution with the filmmaker of a Canadian documentary chronicling rescue efforts during the Oct. 7, 2023, Hamas attack on Israel, reversing an earlier decision to pull the film and confirming it will be screened at this year’s festival. “We have worked together to find […]
title: TIFF Reinstates Screening of Hamas Attack Documentary Following Backlash

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The president says the U.S. role would not involve NATO membership, as a European-led 'coalition of the willing' pushes for robust safeguards in any settlement.
title: Trump Says US Security Guarantees for Ukraine Possible in Peace Deal With Putin

author: Chris Summers
description: A German foreign ministry spokesman said on Friday it 'firmly rejects the Israeli government's announcements' on new settlements in the West Bank.
title: New Settlement ‘Buries the Idea of a Palestinian State,’ Says Israeli Minister

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Representative Caleb Navarro said lawmakers were closing loopholes and strengthening justice to ensure criminals cannot again terrorize Salvadoran families.
title: El Salvadoran Committee Backs Extending Detention of Suspected Gang Members Until 2027

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canadians are opting to carry more cash in their wallets despite the growing prevalence of digital transactions, a new survey from the Bank of Canada suggests. A recent report published by the central bank on 2024 payment methods found that Canadians kept an average of $156 in cash in their pockets, compared to $140 in […]
title: Canadians Carrying More Cash, Says Bank of Canada

author: The Canadian Press
description: A meeting between Canada Post and the union representing 55,000 postal workers has been delayed until next week due to the availability of federal mediators, the company says. The two sides, which were set to meet Friday, will now meet on Aug. 20. It’s been two weeks since members of the Canadian Union of Postal […]
title: Canada Post and Union Meeting Delayed Until Next Week Due to Mediator Availability

author: The Canadian Press
description: Thousands are out of their homes, and many more are on alert to evacuate as wildfires continue to rage across Atlantic Canada. Officials in Newfoundland and Labrador have expanded an evacuation alert along the Bay De Verde Peninsula as the Kingston wildfire burns nearby. The community of Job’s Cove in Newfoundland is affected by the […]
title: Wildfires in Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia Have Residents on High Alert

author: The Canadian Press
description: In its second high-profile reversal in recent months, Quebec’s language watchdog has backed down after trying to get a well-known Montreal pub to change its outdoor sign. The Office québécois de la langue française had instructed Pub Burgundy Lion to add French language to its sign because “burgundy” is an English word. Following a public […]
title: Quebec Language Watchdog Backtracks on Pub Sign It Deemed Too English

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump speaks with the press on Air Force One on his way to Anchorage, Alaska, on Aug. 15.
title: Trump Talks to Press on Air Force One (Aug. 15)

author: Stuart Liess
description: Trump aims to extend the National Guard visit to 30 days, while the District of Columbia mayor calls it 'manufactured intrusion on local authority.'
title: Trump Sends National Guard to DC

author: C.P. Champion
description: Commentary British Columbians and Vancouver Islanders in the Confederation era, like Maritimers and Newfoundlanders, had three choices: become part of the United States, go it alone in splendid isolation, or join a ragged expansionist sub-empire calling itself Canada. Americans took for granted that B.C. would join the United States. A common refrain was: “When British […]
title: The Men Who Made British Columbia

author: Emel Akan
description: The meeting could determine the fate of a long-sought peace deal to end the deadliest conflict in Europe since World War II.
title: Trump Heads to Alaska for Pivotal Summit With Putin on Ukraine War

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Acquisition will see Ampol take over EG Australia’s nationwide fuel network, with annual savings estimated at up to A$80 million.
title: Ampol to Acquire About 500 Petrol Stations in $1.1 Billion Deal

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Students and those without children were found to be the most addicted.
title: 3 in 4 Aussies Aged 18–40 Struggling to Switch Off Their Phones

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Dairy leads grocery inflation, with milk up 16 percent, butter 42 percent, and cheese 30 percent in a year.
title: Dairy and Meat Drive New Zealand Food Prices Up 5 Percent as Cost Pressures Bite

author: Josh Spasaro
description: 'We don’t want Victoria to be seen as a place that’s too hard to do business,' says CEO Scott Veenker of the Committee for Melbourne.
title: Business Groups Push Back on Victoria’s Compulsory Work-From-Home Plan

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee also said Australian hopes of cooperating with the Palestinian Authority were unfounded.
title: US Says Hamas ‘Walked Away’ From Gaza Talks After Albanese’s Palestine Pledge

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: 234 minors are now in detention, with Aboriginal children making up 60 percent of the total.
title: Youth Detention in NSW Jumps 34 Percent, With Aboriginal Overrepresentation at Record High

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The airline is set to ground 500 flights and stop all flights by Aug. 16.
title: Flight Attendants Union Crashes Air Canada Press Conference as Strike Looms

author: Josh Spasaro
description: 'I’ve got friends who have spent over $1 million on properties for dogs,' says former Million Dollar Chase winner Blake Pursell.
title: Greyhound Ban Could Cut Jobs in Feed, Fuel and Dog Homing Industries: Trainer

author: Chandra Philip
description: A fourth individual has been arrested in connection with a smuggling incident that saw a truck carrying nearly 50 foreign nationals intercepted in southern Quebec, according to the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA). Quebec police intercepted the truck near the town of Stanstead near Haskell Road on Aug. 3, according to CBSA. The foreign nationals […]
title: 4th Man Arrested After Nearly 50 Migrants Smuggled Into Quebec in Back of Truck: Border Agency

author: Chandra Philip
description: More than half of Canadians say they want more evidence to prove that soil anomalies found at former residential schools were unmarked graves. The Tk’emlups te Secwepemc First Nation released a report in May 2021 that said the remains of 215 children were found using ground-penetrating radar around a former Indian Residential School in Kamloops, […]
title: Two-Thirds of Canadians Say Additional Evidence Needed to Prove Unmarked Graves at Kamloops Residential School

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The two leaders are set to meet in Alaska on Aug. 15 to discuss a way to end the ongoing Russia–Ukraine conflict.
title: 5 Things to Know Ahead of Trump’s Meeting With Putin
